page.title: 13THE BISHOP'S PARKLAND
page.content: {Auckland Castle}is the residence of the Bishops of Durham. The{Bishop's {Park}is a favourite beauty spot. The parkland gave its name to the town which was also known as Pollard's Land. {St.Andrew's Parish Church,}on a hill 2km to the south, is an important landmark in the village of South Church. Bishop Bek ordered it to be built in 1292. The tower is 25m tall. There were older churches on the site but nothing remains except a{Saxon {Cross.}It has been rebuilt inside the church opposite the door. Across the{River Gaunless}is another old church building, the {East {Dearnery.}The north part was built with the church for the priests to live in. In the C17 it became a farmhouse and later a private house. It has just become disused.
